unnormalised: The chaos at the SBI branch in Patna started building around 10:00 AM. It wasn't the usual Monday morning rush; this was different. Apparently, a rumour had spread like wildfire that the branch was distributing free ₹500 notes to celebrate some vague "RBI anniversary."
normalised: The chaos at the S-B-I branch in Patna started building around ten zero zero A-M. It wasn't the usual Monday morning rush; this was different. Apparently, a rumor had spread like wildfire that the branch was distributing free rupee five hundred notes to celebrate some vague "R-B-I anniversary."

unnormalised: By 10:30 AM, the scene outside the bank was bordering on mayhem. Hundreds had gathered, shoving and pushing, all eager to get their hands on the mythical free money. Many were daily wage labourers who’d skipped work, hoping for an easy Rs. 500 boost to their meager earnings. An auto-rickshaw driver, named Rajesh, abandoned his rickshaw mid-street, joining the throng.

unnormalised: The incident served as a stark reminder of the power of misinformation and the economic vulnerability of many in the region. The SBI branch, after suffering minor damages to its entrance, resumed normal operations by 2:00 PM, but the legend of the "free ₹500" will likely linger in Patna for quite some time. A formal inquiry has been initiated to trace the origin of the rumour.
